TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ProcessInfo extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Provides information on processes currently executing.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This class returns information about ASP.NET worker processes that are running under the ASP.NET process model. Objects of this type are returned by the static methods <xref:System.Web.ProcessModelInfo.GetCurrentProcessInfo%2A?displayProperty=fullName> and <xref:System.Web.ProcessModelInfo.GetHistory%2A?displayProperty=fullName>. These methods are the only useful ways to create an initialized object.
> [!NOTE] > If you are using Microsoft Internet Information Services (IIS) 6.0, process metrics returned by the <xref:System.Web.ProcessInfo> classes are available only if you are running in IIS 5.0 isolation mode. If you are using IIS 6.0 in worker process isolation mode, the ASP.NET process model is disabled and an <xref:System.Web.HttpException> exception is thrown when you access <xref:System.Web.ProcessInfo> members.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates using the <xref:System.Web.ProcessInfo.Age%2A>, <xref:System.Web.ProcessInfo.PeakMemoryUsed%2A>, <xref:System.Web.ProcessInfo.ProcessID%2A>, <xref:System.Web.ProcessInfo.RequestCount%2A>, <xref:System.Web.ProcessInfo.ShutdownReason%2A>, <xref:System.Web.ProcessInfo.StartTime%2A> and <xref:System.Web.ProcessInfo.Status%2A> properties of the <xref:System.Web.ProcessInfo> class. The example displays a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LinkButton>. When the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LinkButton> is clicked, the current process information is displayed.
<!-- TODO: review snippet reference [!code-csharp[ProcessInfo#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/ProcessInfo/CS/processinfocs.aspx#1)] --> <!-- TODO: review snippet reference [!code-vb[ProcessInfo#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/ProcessInfo/VB/processinfovb.aspx#1)] -->

remarks.format: ## Remarks This class returns information about ASP.NET worker processes that are running under the ASP.NET process model. Objects of this type are returned by the `static` methods <xref:System.Web.ProcessModelInfo.GetCurrentProcessInfo%2A?displayProperty=fullName> and <xref:System.Web.ProcessModelInfo.GetHistory%2A?displayProperty=fullName>. These methods are the only useful ways to create an initialized <xref:System.Web.ProcessInfo> object.

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class and sets internal information indicating the status of the process.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This class returns information about ASP.NET worker processes that are running under the ASP.NET process model. Objects of this type are returned by the static methods <xref:System.Web.ProcessModelInfo.GetCurrentProcessInfo%2A?displayProperty=fullName> and <xref:System.Web.ProcessModelInfo.GetHistory%2A?displayProperty=fullName>. These methods are the only useful ways to create an initialized <xref:System.Web.ProcessInfo> object.

Docs.summary: Gets the length of time the process has been running.
Docs.value: A that indicates the time elapsed since the process started.

Docs.summary: Gets the maximum amount of memory the process has used.
Docs.value: The maximum memory used, in kilobytes (KB).

Docs.summary: Gets the ID number assigned to the process.
Docs.value: The process ID number assigned by Windows.

Docs.summary: Gets the number of start requests for the process.
Docs.value: The number of requests executed by the process.
